name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Liverpool

reviews.text: Stayed for one night on business Room was clean. Some mould around bath area. Seal at base of shower screen was missing so floor got soaked. Free Wi-fi wouldn't connect . Bar was expensive and not much choice. Breakfast was good. Parking is expensive. Location is good.
reviews.title: Good but not outstanding

reviews.text: Recently spent a weekend here with a friend. The staff were great. Friendly and helpful both on reception, in the restaurant, and in the bar. However, the swimming pool was far from great. The staircase was corroded and the place looked generally tatty, definitely time for a refurbishment. The pool was luke warm, as was the jacuzzi. The steam room was ok but the place was just scruffy in general. No robes provided as a matter of course either - take note if you plan to visit.
reviews.title: Needs a facelift.....

reviews.text: Breakfast, like the pool was luke warm. There was a good variety of food to choose from, fresh bread, rolls, croissants etc and fruit and cereal as well as the traditional cooked foods. To describe it as hot would be wrong.
reviews.title: Valued

reviews.text: Room was comfortable and clean as was the bathroom.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location, just about ten minutes walk from the quay, with Albert Docks a little further on. Tesco Express and a small Sainsburys are only a couple of minutes away - very handy for the odd snack etc.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: Stayed here for a reunion in November 2011. Small rooms with uninspiring views - breakfast service was poorly organised and tables were dirty. One of the two lifts was not working all weekend and staff seemed uninterested, this meant walking up to the fourth floor or waiting up to 15 minutes for the single working lift (one of our part was on a higher floor and was very unhappy. Location was ok but a 10-15 minute walk to the main tourist areas.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: We stayed last weekend 03/12/11. Wanted to see Liverpool's nightlife. Hotel was close to everything and if you want a taxi they come within 5 minutes. Hotel has very friendl staff, room service 24hr, it's sparkling clean, minibar with sandwiches etc brilliant for a 3am binge. The food for breakfast was amazing and the dinner was even better. Lots to choose from. Clean towells daily, tv, we watched a film on the Saturday afternoon. We did order 2 burgers and chips at 3am and it came to £25, a bit steep and we fell a sleep and left it outside the room, I woke up with just a bun and no burger!! ha!! I was unfortunate enough also, when we went out to News Bar my bag was stolen, so anyone visiting Liverpool please do be careful when out at night, people were lovely saying that but heard it's known to get stuff pinched. Hotel staff helped me call the police etc. I LOVE THIS HOTEL :) XXX
reviews.title: Excellent location, Clean, Peaceful - great hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel three times now - two for business and one for pleasure and in all instances I've walked away ambivalent about this hotel. It's neither great nor terrible and fundamentally it's mediocrity is it's biggest problem.
reviews.title: A very mixed bag

reviews.text: Front of house reception consistently failed to please - all whom I encountered genuinely act as though you are a hinderance to their daily lives. I was unimpressed to be told there was no valet parking offered (despite this being mentioned on their website) and as a lone woman I did not appreciate being directed to park in an unmanned car park down an unlit road. I felt very uncomfortable walking down that road on my own in the dark not to mention worried my car was insecurely parked!
reviews.title: Great base for Liverpool shopping and Sightseeing

reviews.text: The rooms are perfectly adequate though lack any character. All three rooms I stayed in were clean and well appointed and I enjoyed a comfortable nights sleep every night.
reviews.title: fab hotel

reviews.text: We have stopped at this hotel a number of times but we have felt that the standards have slipped over the past couple of years.
reviews.title: Standards have slipped

reviews.text: We stopped here in July, partly for business and pleasure but felt disappointed throughout. The check in staff seem uninterested and unhelpful, and dont make you feel very welcoming.
reviews.title: 3 nights stay

reviews.text: The room we were given looked tired and dated - the upholstery on the furniture looked worn and dated, and the bathroom looked dirty.
reviews.title: Not a comfortable night

reviews.text: What let us down the most was the 'super breakfast' - this was one of the reasons we used to stop at this hotel! The food was not great, and my partner found some mould on some bread, I found a hair in my food, which completly put us off.
reviews.title: Mixed

reviews.text: What disappointed me the most was not one member of staff asked if we had enjoyed our stay or gave us an opportunity to air our grievences, nor did they respond to a email highlighting the above.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but nothing special

reviews.text: I stayed here for just one night and it felt a bit like everything that could, did go wrong! I specifically asked for a quiet room, away from lifts and aircon. First room was next door to a lift, moved again, right next door to the aircon units on a mezzanine floor, looking at my window - moved again. Room was ok - large beds, as you expect with a Radisson.
reviews.title: Average hotel in great location

reviews.text: Got up early to hit the gym - opens 6.30am according to their website. The gym manager turned up at 7am, I missed breakfast and waited around for 30 minutes! NOT acceptable and NO apology - I had to turn the lights on myself!!!!
reviews.title: Avoid

reviews.text: There are better hotels to stay in.
reviews.title: Massive comfy beds!

reviews.text: We were there one day on a wine tasting course. Whilst waiting to start we went to the lounge bar for a coffee. It was filthy and the bar staff were dreadful. When I asked for a teaspoon to stir my coffee I was told to use a straw! The floor in the lounge was covered in remenants of the night before and the tables were sticky. We cancelled and came home.
reviews.title: Beautiful Raddison - 2nd Wk August 2011

reviews.text: Stayed here just for one night...but would stay here again. seemed to be a little out of centre but not too far to walk to bars.
reviews.title: Mostly great !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Radisson blu to look at the hotel as a wedding venue and have a little break, the room was beautiful and clean, in fact it was spotless and had everything we could have asked for,great location and views, loads of toiletries, fridge fully stocked :) The girls on reception were very helpful, we also had our car parked for us on arrival. The hotel staff could not have done enough for us, breakfast was lovely and fresh. If you are thinking about it, book it! also when we arrived yesterday there was a guy playing the piano in the bar/reception area, very relaxing! We have decided that The Radisson blu would be a great place for our wedding! Funny as the taxi driver we had last night said he came to a wedding here and it was fabulous!!!
reviews.title: Amazing stay & amazing service!!!
Nice enough hotel
reviews.text: I am submitting this review AFTER reading all the negative ones....as I found nothing to relate to with them.....except...the spa...I purposely booked the hotel as the spa looked so appealing in the photos ....yet in reality it's nothing like the photos show....the jacuzzi was warm...bordering cold..I didn't even attempt to go in the pool as it was colder still.....I didn't like the idea of walking up the spiral staircase I felt quite dizzy walking down and not a big fan of those sort of staircase especially when wet!.....I suffer with claustrophobia and found that the spa did leave me feeling a bit stressed rather than de stressed!.....the hotel on the other hand was spacious and well kept...our room was welcoming and pleasant with a lovely view..I purposely asked for a lower landing room and was happy on the second floor as I didn't have to walk up too many flights of stairs as I couldn't use the lift.....the hotel was clean tidy and right enough for our girlie weekend. Breakfast was lovely with everything you could ask for....the staff warm and friendly...and most helpful....especially one young man who was most helpful....room service was prompt and the pizza that we ordered was tasty...a comfortable night spent on the first night of our trip and the same for the second.....the hotel was almost everything we wanted like I said the spa let it down for us....but that wouldn't put us off staying again as it didn't upset us that much....on checking out the staff helped us just as much as whilst we were staying so if another trip comes up in Liverpool we would definitely check out the offers on at this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night as we were coming up from London to watch the football. We arrived at the hotel on Saturday 24 March at 1.30pm and were told that check in was at 2pm and there was not one single double bedroom ready!!! We had been driving for 4 hours and wanted to change and freshen up as we going to a corporate event. We were told we could use the public toilets to change in and that we could leave our luggage with them at no charge and when we return could collect when we check in (as though he was doing us a favour at not charging us). I have travelled the world and the UK and have never been told 30mins before check in that the room is not available or any room is available or that they charge to keep your luggage before or after check out. When having no choice we used the public toilets and asked that while we were changing could they order a cab for us, when we came back less than 10 mins later the guy told us we could catch one from outside the hotel as they came pass regularly or he could order us one but we better not jump into a black cab if that comes 1st!!!! We asked what did he recommend as we were in a hurry and he said it was up to us, in the end we ordered a cab and waited 10 mins more it showed up and ran late due to the desk clerk's unhelpfulness. I expected better from the Radisson chain and was let down as this was a one off for us to see my partners team play and enjoy sometime in Liverpool.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: The hotel is in the business district which for us was great as we wanted to be in a quiet part of the city as we were running a half marathon early the next day. If you wanted a base for a night out it's around a 10 minute walk to livelier parts of the city. The service in the hotel was excellent- £10 breakfast offered at check in that we could book upto midnight and a late check out at no additional cost. The rooms were clean and comfortable but not luxurious. We had picked the hotel as we wanted to use the spa but that turned out to be disappointing. Overall it was tired and grubby. The jacuzzi was cold, paint was peeling from the walls, steam room had no steam and the spiral staircase was rusting. Dirty towels littered the changing rooms. Maybe it was just an off day but the spa is not somewhere we would want to hurry back to.
reviews.title: Excellent service, disappointing spa

reviews.text: Stayed at Radisson Blu Liverpool for five nights middle of March. Checkin was impressive and efficient. Was updraged to Biz class room due to silver Club Calrson card. during checkin was asked for which newspaper I would like to be delivered in the morning. Got a nice room on the 7th floor with excellent views of the mersey side. Its a clean and quite hotel at a good enough location. So far so good.
reviews.title: Very average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in September, staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble,we were able to check in early meaning we used the Spa in the morning including having a hot stone massage- the best i have ever had!! The rooms were comfortable and modern and the hotel lobby itself is stunning.
reviews.title: Really Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the spa staff were absolutely superb i felt the facilities were a little dated and scruffy and also quite cold the jacuzzi particularly wasn't brilliant, this isn't the sort of spa you could spend your time lounging in it was more scurrrying between the sauna and the pool or steam etc.
reviews.title: No Complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent quality with plenty of choice and again the staff were fantastic.
reviews.title: A quiet oasis with a fabulous view of the Mersey
Love the view and the interior design- but
reviews.text: The hotel was situated in a brilliant location which meant a short walk brought you right into the centre of Liverpool.

This is a striking building and access is quite easy. I was a bit peeved when the 'valet parking' with no mention of cost turned out to be a £20 per 24hr fee. A hidden expense. Joy when on arrival there was no valet parking available. I was directed to the very near NCP car park where the cost was £31 for the stay as opposed to the hotels £40. The reception staff were very pleasant and registering was easy. The card system for lifts and internal connecting doors was a good security feature, your door key card allows you to move about within the hotel. My partner was unimpressed with access to the spa and swimming pool areas and critical of possible dangerous stairs connecting steam room, pool and other facilities. The room was clean and well appointed. No complaints. Good view across The Mersey (business class room)
reviews.title: recent stay

reviews.text: Glasses, crockery and cutlery all grubby in dining room - necessary to ask for all items to be changed.
reviews.title: cleanliness: A lot to be desired

reviews.text: stale open and half eaten pringles tubs in the mini bar - obviously not checked.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: Bedroom carpet stained with yellow matter.
reviews.title: Good location, untidy entrance hall, noisy aircon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very noisy air con
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Worst of all breakfast waiter had cold, sniffed continuously and wiped nose on hand while attending tables.
reviews.title: Good hotel, poor customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is good and clean for the price we paid. We booked via travel republic with the accomodation provider being smilo. The room was clean and very spacious. The breakfast buffet is below par and does not suit the hotels reputation. On checking out I was informed that the hotel had not been paid and i needed to provide payment. I spoke to travel republic who advised me that the problem had been sorted however it hadnt and I am now chasing a refund from them which is in itself a lengthy proceadure as I had been charged twice for the room. Overall a good stay at a good hotel but I would deffinatley avoid booking it via travel republic.
reviews.title: Good hotel - do not book via travel republic

reviews.text: When the wind blows down this street, it really blows. We arrived at the hotel late afternoon and had been pre-warned about the car parking. We were lucky enough to get an on-street space at the front of the hotel. This is charged between 8 am and 6 pm, and although not cheap it is far cheaper than the hotels own parking at £20 per day. We were welcomed by the reception staff who were very helpful. We were even provided with a free tourist map of Liverpool and directions to the restaurant of our choice "Gusto" at Albert dock. (recommended).
reviews.title: Good hotel - spotless - good facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lifts operate on your room key card, a bit quirky but an added security measure. They are a little temperamental though, and you can find yourself on the ground floor cussing at the buttons.
reviews.title: Avoid Avoid Avoid - The Worst!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was large and well equipped and had a huge bed. (2 x 3ft beds zipped together). The washroom was modern and spotlessly clean with good toiletries provided. We did not have any heating issues.
reviews.title: Great stay - kept to Radisson Blu standard

reviews.text: We had breakfast at the hotel, self-service, lots of choice but not the hottest. Toast is done in a pop-up toaster and is very slow, even without a queue. Quality of food was good. We did not use the restaurant for any other meals.
reviews.title: All comforts I could ask for

aka: Radisson Blu Hotel, Liverpool Hotel Liverpool
